item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Different though the sexes are, they inter-mix. In every human being a vacillation from one sex to the other takes place, and often it is only the clothes that keep the male or female likeness, while underneath the sex is the very opposite of what it is above. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The truth is, I often like women. I like their unconventionality. I like their completeness. I like their anonymity. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Anyone who has ever struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Everybody's journey is individual. If you fall in love with a boy, you fall in love with a boy. The fact that many Americans consider it a disease says more about them than it does about homosexuality. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Hatred, which could destroy so much, never failed to destroy the man who hated, and this was an immutable law." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I love America more than any other country in the world and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Life is tragic simply because the earth turns and the sun inexorably rises and sets, and one day, for each of us, the sun will go down for the last, last time. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Nothing is more desirable than to be released from an affliction, but nothing is more frightening than to be divested of a crutch. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Most of us are about as eager to be changed as we were to be born, and go through our changes in a similar state of shock. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "The paradox of education is precisely this - that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Luce Irigaray
item.description: "Sexual difference is probably the issue in our time which could be our 'salvation' if we thought it through." -- Luce Irigaray

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "I am making an argument for the cyborg as a fiction mapping our social and bodily reality and as an imaginative resource suggesting some very fruitful couplings. Michael Foucault's. biopolitics is a flaccid premonition of cyborg politics, a very open field." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "By the late twentieth century, our time, a mythic time, we are all chimeras, theorized and fabricated hybrids of machine and organism; in short, we are cyborgs." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna J. Haraway
item.description: "The cyborg is a creature in a post-gender world; it has no truck with bisexuality, pre-oedipal symbiosis, unalienated labour, or other seductions to organic wholeness through a final appropriation of all the powers of the parts into a higher unity." -- Donna J. Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna J. Haraway
item.description: "Cyborgs are not reverent; they do not re-member the cosmos. They are wary of holism, but needy for connection- they seem to have a natural feel for united front politics, but without the vanguard party. The main trouble with cyborgs, of course, is that they are the illegitimate offspring of militarism and patriarchal capitalism, not to mention state socialism. But illegitimate offspring are often exceedingly unfaithful to their origins." -- Donna J. Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna J. Haraway
item.description: "Late twentieth-century machines have made thoroughly ambiguous the difference between natural and art)ficial, mind and body, self-developing and externally designed, and many other distinctions that used to apply to organisms and machines. Our machines are disturbingly lively, and we ourselves frighteningly inert." -- Donna J. Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "Consciousness of exclusion through naming is acute. Identities seem contradictory, partial, and strategic." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "The cyborg is a kind of disassembled and reassembled, postmodern collective and personal self. This is the self feminists must code." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Donna Haraway
item.description: "Cyborg writing must not be about the Fall, the imagination of a once-upon-a-time wholeness before language, before writing, before Man. Cyborg writing is about the power to survive, not on the basis of original innocence, but on the basis of seizing the tools to mark the world that marked them as other." -- Donna Haraway

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Chuck Noll
item.description: "Good things happen to those who hustle." -- Chuck Noll

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Nawal El Saadawi
item.description: "My work is not worthy of respect. Why then do you join in it with me?" -- Nawal El Saadawi
